"That's a good idea Vlady..."said the femme "Can I tell you Vlady?"


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> As nearly as he could tell, Vlad saw no one move after the initial 
> exchange. He thought of his options. He could start firing, but he 
had 
> not decided which group was the best to go with. Those Rogues were 
> greater in number, but that did not prove anything. Ice Hellion 
> Warriors were many, and their prowess in combat did not reflect 
this. 
> The Tripredacus, on the other hand, seemed less organized, even 
though 
> they seemed better armed.
> 
> His declaration of being the object of the trial of possession 
might 
> motivate them, but he harbored no illusions. He was a human, 
unknown 
> to these machines. He had not proven himself, but was confident he 
> could be of some use.
> 
> Then, there was this female robot. He did not know who she was or 
> which team she was in, but it seemed as though she had a clear 
> mission, maybe even unknown to her. There had to be a way he could 
> bring her with him.
> 
> In all these options, running was not present. It was the cowards 
way 
> out, and Wolf Warriors were not cowards.
> 
> Or... yes...
> 
> He fired his two missile racks in the air and forty tiny explosions 
> peppered the sky. He intended to make a show.
> 
> Vlad: I AM KHAN VLADIMIR WARD OF CLAN WOLF. I DO NOT KNOW WHO YOU 
ARE, 
> BUT I RECOGNIZE YOUR VALUE AS WARRIORS. I SUGGEST A TEMPORARY 
> CEASE-FIRE SO WE MAY DISCUSS BETTER AMONG EQUALS.
> 
> He knew the chances that the enemies see themselves as equals were 
> slim, but it was worth trying.
